intro: Rhinanthus brachyodontus, commonly known as the short-toothed rhinoceros flower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and heathlands. Its flowers are yellow and clustered in racemes, with distinctive tubular corollas. It is characterized by its short, blunt teeth on the corolla lobes, giving it its specific epithet "brachyodontus."
